Termination for Convenience.text: Either party may terminate this Agreement for convenience upon thirty (30) days prior written notice to the other party.
Termination for Convenience.hypothesis: One party can terminate without notice period

Termination for Convenience.text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement, in whole or in part, for its convenience by giving the other Party at least sixty (60) days prior written notice.
Termination for Convenience.hypothesis: One party can terminate without notice period

Termination for Convenience.text: This Agreement may be terminated by either party upon ninety (90) days written notice to the other party for any reason or no reason.
Termination for Convenience.hypothesis: One party can terminate without notice period

Termination for Convenience.text: Either party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement for convenience upon providing thirty (30) days advance written notice.
Termination for Convenience.hypothesis: One party can terminate without notice period

Termination for Convenience.text: Any party may terminate this Agreement for its own convenience by giving the other party not less than forty-five (45) days prior written notice.
Termination for Convenience.hypothesis: One party can terminate without notice period

Uncapped Liability.text: Each party's total aggregate liability under this Agreement shall not exceed the total fees paid or payable by Customer to Company during the twelve (12) months preceding the claim.
Uncapped Liability.hypothesis: Liability has no upper monetary limit

Uncapped Liability.text: Company's maximum liability arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be limited to an amount equal to twelve (12) months of the fees paid by Customer.
Uncapped Liability.hypothesis: Liability has no upper monetary limit

Uncapped Liability.text: Neither party's liability for any claim arising out of this Agreement shall exceed one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) or the total fees paid, whichever is greater.
Uncapped Liability.hypothesis: Liability has no upper monetary limit

Uncapped Liability.text: The total liability of each party to the other shall not exceed the amount of fees paid by Customer to Provider in the twelve months prior to the claim.
Uncapped Liability.hypothesis: Liability has no upper monetary limit

Uncapped Liability.text: Except for indemnification obligations, each party's liability shall be capped at three (3) times the annual fees paid under this Agreement.
Uncapped Liability.hypothesis: Liability has no upper monetary limit

Non Compete.text: Each party may freely engage in any business activities, including those that compete with the other party, subject only to confidentiality obligations.
Non Compete.hypothesis: Parties cannot compete with each other

Non Compete.text: Nothing in this Agreement restricts either party's right to develop, market, or provide competing products or services to third parties.
Non Compete.hypothesis: Parties cannot compete with each other

Non Compete.text: The parties acknowledge each has the right to conduct business independently and compete with the other, except as limited by confidentiality terms.
Non Compete.hypothesis: Parties cannot compete with each other

Non Compete.text: Except for confidentiality obligations, neither party shall restrict the business activities or competitive opportunities of the other party.
Non Compete.hypothesis: Parties cannot compete with each other

Non Compete.text: Each party retains full rights to pursue business opportunities, serve competitors, and engage in competitive activities without restriction.
Non Compete.hypothesis: Parties cannot compete with each other
